mods.note: TABLE OF THE RULING All BIT KHARAIBAN (NATM) FAMILY OF 'AJMAN IN TSUCIAli OMAN. Chronological list of the Shaikhs of 'Aj'mdn belonging to this family. Baghid. Hamaid-biu-Bashid. Eashid-bin-Hatnaid, from before 1820 till 1838. Hamaid-bifr-Bashid, 1838-41 and from 1848 till before 1873. 'Abdal 'Azlz-bin-Eashid, 1841.48. ESs hid-bin-Hamaid, from before 1873 till 1891. Hamaid-bin-Eashid, 1891-1900. 'Abdul 'Aziz, Bince 1900. RASHID. (Dead.) HAMAID. (Dead.) RASHID. (Shaikh from before 1820 till 1838 ; died, 1838.) Notes.—1. The date of compilation of this table is 1907. 2. All females are, with one exception, omilted j probably also a number of distant male collaterals of the present ruling branchy 3. Children of the same father are given in order cf seniority from left to right, except that the only woman shown has been arbi trarily placed on the right of her brothers. 4. Dates of birth are approximate only. 6. When the fact or date of death is not mentioned the person was alive in 1906, BAMA1D (Shaikh 1888-41. and from 1848 till before 1873; dead.) ABDUL AZIZ (Usurped the Shaikh- ship from his brother Hamaid in 1841 and ruled till 1848; killed in fighting with Hamriyah, 1848.) X RASHID. (Succeeded his father as Shaikh and ruled till 1891; died, 1891.) j*e\J Nasir. HAMAID (Succeededhis father as Shaikh, 1891; ruled tiil 1900, whea he was murdered by his uncle 'Abdul 'Aziz.) Nasir. (Born, 1879 ; blind ed by tho present Shaikh, who also ex pelled him; lives in poor circumstances at Hamriyah.) Saqar. (Bom, 1885 ; ex pelled from 'Ajman by the present Shaikh ; lives at Hamriyah with his blind brother Nasir.) ABDUL 'AZIZ. (Born, 1851 ; killed his nephew Hamaid- bin Eashid, 1900; Shaikh since 1900.) Muhammati A daughter. (Married Ahmad-bin 'Abdullah, late Shaikh of Umm-al-Qaiwain ; mother of Eashid, the present Shaikh of that place.) Hamaid. (Born, 1876; lives at 'Ajman.) Kashid. r JU Salim. Sultan Majid. RasMd. (Bom, 1856 ; lives at Sharjah, not being on good terms with the present Shaikh.) Muhammad. (Born. 1861 ; ex pelled from 'Ajman bv the present Shaikh; lives at Hamriyah with the blind Nasir-bin- Bashid.) siJlo.xc Abdullah. (Boro, 1871, expell ed from 'Ajman by theprepent Shaikh; lives at Hamriyah.) Kashid. Nasir. (Born, 1871 ; ex pelled from 'Ajman by the present Shaikh; lives at Hamriyah.)

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Pocket No. 6: Enclosure to Part III of Volume I of the Persian Gulf Gazetteer: Genealogical Table of the Al Bū Kharaiban (Na’īm) Family of ’Ajman in Trucial ’Omān'

mods.abstract: This item is a genealogical 'Table of the Ruling Āl Bū Kharaibān (Na’īm) Family of ’Ajmān in Truciāl ’Omān'. It contains 31 named and unnamed individuals (in Arabic and English) of the Āl Bū Khuraybān (Āl Nu‘aymī) family of Ajman, some with birth and death dates, as well as brief biographical information.There is also a 'Chronological list of Shaikhs of ’Ajmān belonging to this family' with the periods of their reign, including: Rāshid, Hamaid-bin-Rāshid [Ḥumayd bin Rāshid], Rāshid-bin-Hamaid [Rāshid bin Ḥumayd], Hamaid-bin-Rāshid [Ḥumayd bin Rāshid], ’Abdul ’Azīz-bin-Rāshid [‘Abd al-‘Azīz bin Rāshid], Rāshid-bin-Hamaid [Rāshid bin Ḥumayd], Hamaid-bin-Rāshid [Ḥumayd bin Rāshid], and ’Abdul ’Azīz [‘Abd al-‘Azīz].In addition, a section of 'Notes' is included that gives 1907 as the year of compilation, as well as other details concerning the arrangement of the table, including: the omission of all female apart from one, and probably a number of male collateral relatives; 'issue' means 'male issue'; the ordering of children of the same father according to seniority from left to right, with the only females placed at the right of her brothers; dates of birth are approximate; and when the fact or date of death is not mentioned the person was probably alive in 1906.
